TopicTitle: Who Is Working On The Kraken Drive?

Articles.Content:
Who is working on a Kraken Drive here?

One of our forumers at KSP has been working on an Kraken drive to send a ship to Eeloo in 11 hours.

Of course, being me, I didn't want to be outdone by this, and immediately ordered my Kerbals to work on an FTL drive capable of reaching 10c for an interstellar expedition.

Here is a quick log of my experiments:

Test Flight-1

Crew: Jebediah Kerman

Craft: X-18W

Outcome: Craft launched itself horizontally sideways into the VAB doors with an top speed of 50 m/s. Jebediah was hospitalized for severe injuies, and is not expected to go back on duty anytime soon.

Test Flight-2

Craft: X-18WA

Crew: Nedbob Kerman

Outcome: Craft reached Apogee of 20KM and travelled halfway across the ocean near KSC. Pilot recovered safely, claims "black magic engine" is "epic and awesome".

Test Flight-3

Craft: X-19W

Crew: Bill

Outcome: Craft fell apart on pad, but the opening of launch sequence propelled pod to 200M. Bill was safely recovered.

Conclusion: A Kraken Drive is certainly feasible, but needs much more work. However, I have doubts about its ability to send an manned vessel safely, due to high G-forces sustained by test pilots, and angry locals who claim KSC is possessing their spacecraft with magic. Further Work will be needed.

However, one question intrigues me. Who else is working on such a drive?

Shall we do a technology race?
I feel like it's not going to last long so I just made the one and called it quits.

Shall we do a technology race?

It should be obvious by now that several ppl and companies are racing to be the first to post something practical. Good luck, and dont forget to share your discoveries.
Remember to share subassemblies if you get one that's practical!
SSI has posted a practical mini K-Drive in the Tyrene rover builders thread.

SSI has posted a practical mini K-Drive in the Tyrene rover builders thread.

Can you post a link the thread, I can't seem to find it.

I've been mucking about with it out of curiosity - I've no use for it as a thing, but I'd hoped to rendezvous one with my tour craft for a photo opportunity. I've had little practical success - while it's very powerful when it works, channelling the power into a useful direction has proved much harder, just trying to get a Mun intercept is a pain in the backside... and it has a nasty tendency to break when switched on, or switched off, or when it feels like it, or when getting close to planetary bodies... ^^

It ended up as a side effect of me trying to make a warp drive. I'm letting others like SSI continue its development while I work on my original task.

However I'm still keeping the Tyrene thread up to date on its latest developments.

SSI K-Drive Series Lead reporting in!

We have one of the first (and smallest) K-Drive spacecraft up, the SSI Quark (Type 1 K-Drive Shuttlecraft). Check out the general catalog soon; it isn't posted yet, but Inigma stated he is busy and will update ASAP.

Edited March 7, 2014 by FCISuperGuy

I've been mucking about with it out of curiosity - I've no use for it as a thing, but I'd hoped to rendezvous one with my tour craft for a photo opportunity. I've had little practical success - while it's very powerful when it works, channelling the power into a useful direction has proved much harder, just trying to get a Mun intercept is a pain in the backside... and it has a nasty tendency to break when switched on, or switched off, or when it feels like it, or when getting close to planetary bodies... ^^

True. My 2m drives always break in 2 seconds, but somehow my 1m drives are reliable as hell. Just can't break them even if I try. Try getting a drive with LESS acceleration for precision maneuvers, put on a crapload of RCS, and get both RasterPropMonitor and KSI MFD for better control. They give you LCDs in the cockpit with flight info. I personally use them on K-Drive ships to check my orbit because you can't toggle the drive in map view. Don't worry, the craft is still stock-compatible.
sepatron drive in the works, currently its very impractical and requires a cheat to work... it does however seem to anger the kraken...
What i want to know is How Even Assemble one.

I am working on a huge craft powered by 16 K-Drives. So far so good, but I have had to build a new hospital @space center

EDIT: This is my 100th post, just to remember...

My trials with the K-Drive have resulted in rather impressive debris fields, but not much else. Mostly my massive piles of reaction wheels (I use 'em as filler in my drive mechanisms) end up slung about at great rates of speed. My designs tend to not be very stable.

I've got the idea down, but my concept lacks refinement, usually giving one pulse and breaking down. I've not managed to figure out how to build a K-Drive that fires in a continuous pulse. With luck, I'll figure it out somehow.

EDIT: Seems I'm getting closer to a working prototype. Need to either get the power up or the weight down on my test craft to use it, though.

Edited March 7, 2014 by Madrias

Since I discovered the concept of a Kraken Drive just a few hours ago, I've been trying to develop one with no success. Apparently using the "Start: Deployed" tweakable on the gear de-bugs the part that causes the K-Drive effect to work, and the solution is to "restart the game several times." Clearly I have not restarted enough for it to start working again.
I tried one once, but it barely got off the ground. I'll be leaving this one to those who know more about Kraken Drives and the mysterious force that propels them.

I'm in that same boat, DisarmingBaton5. I can't seem to get them to produce near enough effective thrust to do much more than fart down the runway. When they work. Most of 'em I've made pulse once and jam, or push all my stacked material around rather than making thrust. Or of course, sending my ship flying across the map really fast... as a result of rapid unplanned disassembly.
Perhaps a better understanding on how the Kraken happens could help you trigger it on purpose.
